meanings.definition: A pungent yellow or brown paste made from the crushed seeds of certain plants, typically eaten as a condiment.
meanings.sent1: I added some mustards to my hot dog for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The sandwich tasted better with a hint of mustards.
meanings.sent3: The mustards decided to have a party in the fridge.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as bright as a jar of mustards.
meanings.sent5: The smell of mustards lingered in the kitchen, making my mouth water.

meanings.definition: A plant of the cabbage family with yellow flowers, which are used to make mustard.
meanings.sent1: The mustards in the garden bloomed beautifully in spring.
meanings.sent2: Farmers harvest mustards to create the condiment we love.
meanings.sent3: The mustards whispered secrets to the other vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The field of mustards swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow of the mustards brightened up the whole garden.

meanings.sent1: Her dress was a vibrant shade of mustards.
meanings.sent2: The painting was filled with various shades, including mustards.
meanings.sent3: The mustards of the sunset painted the sky in beauty.
meanings.sent4: The mustards of the field glowed under the sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: The room was bathed in the warm glow of mustards, creating a cozy atmosphere.
